verses.kjv: In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz came to him, and said unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Set thine house in order; for thou shalt die, and not live.
verses.ct: During that time, Hezekiah became deathly ill. The prophet Isaiah son of Amoz came to him and said, "This is what the LORD says: Get your affairs in order, because you are going to die. You will not recover."

verses.kjv: Then he turned his face to the wall, and prayed unto the LORD, saying,
verses.ct: Hezekiah turned toward the wall and prayed to the LORD:

verses.kjv: I beseech thee, O LORD, remember now how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.
verses.ct: "Please, LORD, remember how I have lived my life faithfully in your presence, with complete devotion, and have done what is right in your eyes." Then Hezekiah broke down and wept bitterly.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, afore Isaiah was gone out into the middle court, that the word of the LORD came to him, saying,
verses.ct: Before Isaiah had even left the middle courtyard, the word of the LORD came to him:

verses.kjv: Turn again, and tell Hezekiah the captain of my people, Thus saith the LORD, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will heal thee: on the third day thou shalt go up unto the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: "Go back and tell Hezekiah, the leader of my people, this is what the LORD, the God of your ancestor David, says: I have heard your prayer and I have seen your tears. Look — I will heal you. On the 3rd day, you will go up to the house of the LORD."

verses.kjv: And I will add unto thy days fifteen years; and I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria; and I will defend this city for mine own sake, and for my servant David’s sake.
verses.ct: "I will add 15 years to your life. I will rescue you and this city from the king of Assyria. I will protect this city for my own sake and for the sake of my servant David."

verses.kjv: And Isaiah said, Take a lump of figs. And they took and laid it on the boil, and he recovered.
verses.ct: Then Isaiah said, "Prepare a paste of figs." So they made one and applied it to the infected sore, and Hezekiah recovered.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah said unto Isaiah, What shall be the sign that the LORD will heal me, and that I shall go up into the house of the LORD the third day?
verses.ct: Hezekiah had asked Isaiah, "What will be the sign that the LORD will heal me and that I will go up to the house of the LORD on the 3rd day?"

verses.kjv: And Isaiah said, This sign shalt thou have of the LORD, that the LORD will do the thing that he hath spoken: shall the shadow go forward ten degrees, or go back ten degrees?
verses.ct: Isaiah replied, "The LORD will give you this sign to prove that he will do what he has promised: Should the shadow move forward 10 steps, or should it go back 10 steps?"

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah answered, It is a light thing for the shadow to go down ten degrees: nay, but let the shadow return backward ten degrees.
verses.ct: Hezekiah answered, "It's easy enough for the shadow to move forward 10 steps. No, instead let the shadow move backward 10 steps."

verses.kjv: And Isaiah the prophet cried unto the LORD: and he brought the shadow ten degrees backward, by which it had gone down in the dial of Ahaz.
verses.ct: So the prophet Isaiah called out to the LORD, and the LORD made the shadow move backward 10 steps on the stairway of Ahaz, reversing the steps it had already gone down.

verses.kjv: At that time Berodachbaladan, the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present unto Hezekiah: for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick.
verses.ct: Around that time, Berodachbaladan son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a gift to Hezekiah, because he had heard about Hezekiah's illness.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah hearkened unto them, and shewed them all the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious ointment, and all the house of his armour, and all that was found in his treasures: there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah shewed them not.
verses.ct: Hezekiah welcomed the messengers and showed them his entire treasury — the silver, the gold, the spices, the expensive oils, his armory, and everything stored among his treasures. There was nothing in his palace or in his entire kingdom that Hezekiah did not show them.

verses.kjv: Then came Isaiah the prophet unto king Hezekiah, and said unto him, What said these men? and from whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said, They are come from a far country, even from Babylon.
verses.ct: Then the prophet Isaiah came to King Hezekiah and asked him, "What did these men say? Where did they come from?" Hezekiah answered, "They came from a distant country — from Babylon."

verses.kjv: And he said, What have they seen in thine house? And Hezekiah answered, All the things that are in mine house have they seen: there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shewed them.
verses.ct: Isaiah asked, "What did they see in your palace?" Hezekiah replied, "They saw everything in my palace. There is nothing in my treasuries that I didn't show them."

verses.kjv: And Isaiah said unto Hezekiah, Hear the word of the LORD.
verses.ct: Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, "Listen to the word of the LORD:"

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, that all that is in thine house, and that which thy fathers have laid up in store unto this day, shall be carried into Babylon: nothing shall be left, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "The time is coming when everything in your palace — everything your ancestors have stored up until today — will be carried off to Babylon. Nothing will be left, says the LORD."

verses.kjv: And of thy sons that shall issue from thee, which thou shalt beget, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.
verses.ct: "Some of your own descendants, your own flesh and blood, will be taken away. They will serve as court officials in the palace of the king of Babylon."

verses.kjv: Then said Hezekiah unto Isaiah, Good is the word of the LORD which thou hast spoken. And he said, Is it not good, if peace and truth be in my days?
verses.ct: Hezekiah responded to Isaiah, "The word of the LORD that you have spoken is good." Then he added, "At least there will be peace and stability during my lifetime, won't there?"

verses.kjv: And the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and all his might, and how he made a pool, and a conduit, and brought water into the city, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?
verses.ct: Everything else about Hezekiah's reign — all his accomplishments, and how he constructed a pool and a water tunnel to bring water into the city — is recorded in the official chronicles of the kings of Judah.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah slept with his fathers: and Manasseh his son reigned in his stead.
verses.ct: Hezekiah died and joined his ancestors, and his son Manasseh became king in his place.
